byline.contributor: Palko Karasz contributed reporting from London, and Dimitris Bounias from Athens.

abstract: European Union's ongoing inability to arrive at continent-wide solution to migrant crisis prompts Austria and 9 Balkan states to move independently; measures agreed on include limiting acceptance to refugees from Iraq and Syria, keeping them in Greece and shoring up Macedonia's border; Greek Prime Min Alex Tsipras rebukes decision and pleads for more support in processing migrants.

headline.print_headline: Ten Countries Agree on Actions in Migrant Crisis
headline.main: With E.U. Paralyzed, 10 Nations Try to Stem Migrant Flow

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The moves came as Europe prepares for another surge in people fleeing war and poverty in the Middle East and beyond.
lead_paragraph: The moves came as Europe prepares for another surge in people fleeing war and poverty in the Middle East and beyond.
